revised_title: The Secretion of Free Hydrochloric Acid in the Gastric Juice
tldr: The author investigates the source of free hydrochloric acid in the gastric juice and concludes that it is secreted from the blood corpuscles under pressure in the stomach's capillaries. The acid, along with acid phosphates and chlorides, passes through the gastric tubules and into the stomach, contributing to the formation of gastric juice.
